# Open Short URL

> A powerful, self-hosted URL shortener with advanced analytics, A/B testing, and AI integration.

Open Short URL is an open-source, white-label URL shortening platform designed for businesses, marketers, and privacy-conscious users who need more than basic link shortening. It provides complete data ownership, comprehensive analytics, and enterprise features without vendor lock-in.

## Key Benefits

- **Privacy-First**: Your data stays on your server. No third-party tracking, no data selling.
- **Cost-Effective**: No monthly fees, no link/click limits. One-time infrastructure investment.
- **White-Label Ready**: Custom domain support, branded password pages, personalized branding.
- **Enterprise Features**: A/B testing, webhooks, API keys, role-based access control, 2FA.

## Technology Stack

- **Backend**: NestJS, Prisma, PostgreSQL, Redis (optional)
- **Frontend**: Next.js 16, React 19, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, TanStack Query
- **Security**: JWT, bcrypt, Cloudflare Turnstile
- **AI Integration**: Model Context Protocol (MCP), Built-in AI Chat

---

## Documentation

### Guide

- [Introduction](https://supra126.github.io/open-short-url/en/guide/introduction): Overview of the project, why it exists, and what problems it solves
- [Getting Started](https://supra126.github.io/open-short-url/en/guide/getting-started): Quick start guide for new users to get up and running
- [Installation](https://supra126.github.io/open-short-url/en/guide/installation): Detailed step-by-step installation instructions for different environments
- [Configuration](https://supra126.github.io/open-short-url/en/guide/configuration): Complete guide to environment variables and application settings

### Features

- [URL Shortening](https://supra126.github.io/open-short-url/en/features/url-shortening): Create short URLs with custom slugs, expiration dates, password protection
- [Analytics](https://supra126.github.io/open-short-url/en/features/analytics): Real-time click tracking, geographic data, device/browser stats, UTM tracking
- [A/B Testing](https://supra126.github.io/open-short-url/en/features/ab-testing): Create URL variants with configurable traffic allocation for testing
- [Smart Routing](https://supra126.github.io/open-short-url/en/features/smart-routing): Conditional redirects based on device, location, time (roadmap)
- [Bundles](https://supra126.github.io/open-short-url/en/features/bundles): Organize URLs into themed collections with aggregate analytics
- [Webhooks](https://supra126.github.io/open-short-url/en/features/webhooks): Event notifications with HMAC-SHA256 signature verification
- [API Keys](https://supra126.github.io/open-short-url/en/features/api-keys): Generate and manage API access tokens for integrations
- [Audit Logs](https://supra126.github.io/open-short-url/en/features/audit-logs): Track all user actions and system events

### API Reference

- [API Reference](https://supra126.github.io/open-short-url/en/api/reference): Complete REST API documentation with endpoints, parameters, and examples

### Deployment

- [Docker](https://supra126.github.io/open-short-url/en/deployment/docker): Container-based deployment using Docker and Docker Compose
- [Self-Hosted](https://supra126.github.io/open-short-url/en/deployment/self-hosted): Manual installation guide for VPS or bare-metal servers

---

## AI Integration

### MCP Server (Model Context Protocol)

The MCP server allows AI assistants like Claude Desktop, Cursor, and Windsurf to manage short URLs through natural conversation.

**Installation:**
```bash
npm install -g @open-short-url/mcp
```

**Configuration:**
```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "open-short-url": {
      "command": "open-short-url-mcp",
      "env": {
        "API_URL": "https://your-backend.com",
        "API_KEY": "ak_your_api_key_here"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

**Available Tools (29 total):**
- URL Management: create, list, update, delete, generate QR codes
- Bundle Management: create collections, add/remove URLs, get statistics
- Analytics: click tracking, geographic data, device breakdown
- A/B Testing: create variants, configure traffic allocation

**Resources:**
- [MCP Server NPM Package](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@open-short-url/mcp): Installation and usage
- [MCP Server Documentation](https://github.com/supra126/open-short-url/blob/main/packages/mcp/README.md): Detailed configuration guide

### Built-in AI Chat

Manage URLs through conversational AI directly in the web interface.

**Supported Providers:**
- Anthropic Claude (claude-3-5-sonnet, claude-3-5-haiku)
- OpenAI GPT (gpt-4o, gpt-4o-mini, gpt-4-turbo)
- Google Gemini (gemini-2.0-flash-exp, gemini-1.5-pro)
- Mistral (mistral-large-latest, mistral-medium)
- Cohere (command-r-plus, command-r)

---

## Quick Start

### Prerequisites
- Node.js 18+
- PostgreSQL 14+
- Redis 6+ (optional, for caching)

### Installation Steps

1. Clone the repository:
```bash
git clone https://github.com/supra126/open-short-url.git
cd open-short-url
```

2. Install dependencies:
```bash
pnpm install
```

3. Configure environment:
```bash
cp apps/backend/.env.example apps/backend/.env.local
cp apps/frontend/.env.example apps/frontend/.env.local
```

4. Setup database:
```bash
cd apps/backend
pnpm prisma:migrate
pnpm prisma:seed
```

5. Start development:
```bash
pnpm dev
```

**Default URLs:**
- Frontend: http://localhost:4100
- Backend API: http://localhost:4101
- API Docs: http://localhost:4101/api

**Default Credentials:** admin@example.com / admin123

---

## One-Click Deploy

Deploy instantly to Railway with automatic PostgreSQL and Redis provisioning:

[![Deploy on Railway](https://railway.com/button.svg)](https://railway.com/deploy/EATit9)

---

## Webhook Events

Supported events with HMAC-SHA256 signature verification:

- `url.created`: Triggered when a short URL is created
- `url.updated`: Triggered when a short URL is updated
- `url.deleted`: Triggered when a short URL is deleted
- `url.clicked`: Triggered when a short URL is clicked (includes click data)
- `webhook.test`: Triggered when testing webhook configuration

---

## Use Cases

- **Marketing Campaigns**: Branded short links with UTM tracking and A/B testing
- **Developers**: Self-hosted solution with full API access and no vendor lock-in
- **Privacy Advocates**: Complete data ownership, GDPR compliant, open source

---
